question: steps out of the restroom, in full African regalia Is this what you're looking for? Scotch, blended. Straight.
answer: They say birds can't fly this high.

question: They say only angels can. No -- I'll take the bottle. Thank you. Ah, c-5. The most dangerous explosive material ever invented. Hard to believe that this little contraption could blow up ten city blocks.
answer: Be careful with it, huh?

question: Another movie from an old TV show?
answer: Well, what're you gonna do?

question: Walk out.
answer: That's very funny.

question: No. It isn't. EVERYONE! FASTEN YOUR SEAT BELTS!
answer: WHAT? You crazy bastard!

question: If you don't defuse this bomb, Logan, L.A.'s going to be a new underwater attraction.
answer: Get off my back, Sanchez. I know what I'm doing.

question: Which wire? The red one or the blue one?
answer: Marix has a thing for red. Red cars, red boats, red-headed hookers.

question: So the red one.
answer: That's why I'm gonna say blue.

question: You saved the world again, Logan.
answer: That's my job. I don't think Sanchez would kiss me. He's a forty-year-old man.

question: Let's have it rewritten. Hello?
answer: So when you coming back?

question: Not sure. Whenever I can. I'll call you.
answer: Oh, great, that's helpful. I don't get it, what kind of executive assistant is on 24 hour call?

question: A very good one.
answer: You ask me, your boss is an asshole. When do I get to meet this Charlie guy, anyway?

question: Charlie's not very social.
answer: Yeah, well I think you should quit.

question: Charlie needs me.
answer: I need you. I gotta go save the world.

question: What! Natalie, what?
answer: I thought you were dead. I thought the police might be here. Or your neighbors. Or your parents, here to identify your remains. I saw your car was here, so I knew you weren't carjacked and brutally beaten, left to die on the highway.

question: I'm not...
answer: Hello. Absolutely. I'll be right in.

question: I'm not dead.
answer: But you can understand why I thought so. You missed our date last night. You didn't call or anything. I was just sitting there by myself. I can tolerate a lot, but punctuality and attendance, those rank very high in my list of dating priorities.

question: I can explain. I can explain. Damn.
answer: Just once, I want to date a normal man, without a wife, or a drug addiction, or bondage issues.

question: This is a transmitter. I'll be able to hear everything you say.
answer: Where do I hide it? I'll be nude.

question: Try to get Corwin to talk about the industry, Knox, anything.
answer: Understood. I'm going undercover.

question: I know. You'll do great.
answer: Hot in here, isn't it? Just came here to unwind a little. Business these days is go go go. My company just held an initial pubic offering. So, what business are you in?

question: Hot in here, isn't it? Just came here to unwind a little. Business these days is go go go. My company just held an initial pubic offering. So, what business are you in?
answer: Computers. Software.

question: Computers, hunh? What do you know about this new browser from Knox Technologies? Word on the street is, once they raise capital, they'll rule the industry.
answer: I don't see that happening.

question: Can you not drive my car so fast, Dyl? I'm trying to type.
answer: I drive too fast. Look who's talking. Three double doubles, animal style. Fries. Three chocolate shakes.

question: Here's Corwin's itinerary.
answer: Alright, we'll hit the reception tonight. I only wish we had a clue to go on.

question: Hold that thought. Uh, hello? Expensive equipment.
answer: Sorry.

question: Check this out. New program I just got from a friend in the Bureau. We take that footage from the kidnapping... ... isolate the part of the suspect's face that's revealed, then retriangulate his bone structure... ... and voila! We've got a composite.
answer: Sweet. Now we've got someone to look for.

question: The average investor sees technology stocks as discrete entities, "This one is up 50 points, this one is down 10." It's only through derivative analysis that one sees the real power of that sector. Well, there are so many options. I mean, who can say what the one best choice is?
answer: Keppler-Wilson.

question: For my money, Keppler-Wilson is a strong choice. Thanks.
answer: Anytime. Anytime, day or night, I am... excited ... to be handing out champagne.

question: He's cute.
answer: I'm working.

question: Sixty-five percent of relationships begin in the workplace.
answer: He's a bartender. I need dependable. I need reliable. I need a Volvo man. Miss! Miss! I'd love some champagne.

question: Sorry.
answer: What are you reading? That's the new Michio Kazura. That's not even out in America.

question: You know Michio Kazura?
answer: Hello? Warriors of the Broken Earth? Classic.

question: I know. I just moved back from Tokyo. It was the biggest thing since Haikiri Nomura.
answer: Tomuru nasgawa ishi Tokyo sen!

question: I'm Natalie.
answer: Pete. Good to meet you.

question: Listen, there's an animation festival at the Egyptian this week. I was wondering if you might want to...
answer: Tomorrow night? Eight o'clock?

question: I'll meet you there.
answer: Pardon me. Natalie. Nine o'clock. Thin man.

question: I'm on it. Vegetarian spring roll? Two guns. One ankle, one shoulder.
answer: You call it.

question: You take point. I'll circle behind.
answer: Copy. Excuse me? Excuse me, do you know which way the ladies' room is? Why do they always run?

question: has come around from the other side. His bad guy instincts tell him these women are working together. He's boxed in.
answer: He's going down.

question: That way. There are times I wish we carried guns.
answer: Where's the challenge in that? As she creeps up behind the cover of the rolling laundry carts. She's succeeded in circling behind the Thin Man as he talks on the phone.

question: right behind him. With a coiled towel, she grabs his gun arm and expertly flips him. But he reacts smoothly, rolling over to charge at Natalie, picking her up like a sack of potatoes. As he does, he grabs her right in the tit. Hey! Hands off, assh.... Okay, to summarize? Damn.
answer: Well. That was easy.

question: No, it wasn't. I've seen this before, he's scrambling his calls through a secondary location.
answer: In English?

question: I think that can be arranged. sidles up to the bar. A group of three rednecks are downing shots, one after another. Three shots of tequila, please. And one Tom Collins. Ooh, that is an enticing offer. But I got a better idea. How about a shot contest? My treat? Okay, I'll take that as a yes. Bartender? Bring ten shots of tequila over to my table. And keep em coming.
answer: Mind if I try?

question: Hey, I've got an idea. Now let's have a chair throwing contest. Chair throwing? Never heard of it? You just pick up your chair and throw it as far as you can. Guten Tag!
answer: Guten Morgen!

question: I think we're in the clear. Or maybe not.
answer: Oh God, no.

question: What is it?
answer: I have a date with Pete. Right now.

question: We're good. I've got surveillance on all the windows. Don't answer the door, don't answer the phone. Also, stay away from the windows.
answer: They're bullet-proof. The last owner was paranoid.

question: Lucky for us. This is a panic button. Press it and one of us can be here in ten minutes.
answer: Which one of you?

question: Whoever's closest.
answer: I have a better idea.

question: What?
answer: Stay for dinner. I'm a pretty good cook.

question: I can't Mr. Knox. I'm sorry. If you...
answer: I'm scared. Look, I didn't want to admit it, but I am. I was kidnapped once, and it wasn't fun. I know, you probably have other plans, but it would be very reassuring. Come on, don't make me beg. I'm embarrassed already.

question: Don't be. That's you, hunh? Cute kid. Cute family.
answer: Thanks. It's the only picture I have of me with my parents. They died a week later.

question: Oh. Oh, I'm sorry. I had no idea...
answer: Please, don't apologize. I was too young to understand. I never knew how they died. When I was a kid, when I got shuffled from one foster home to another, I always thought they just disappeared.

question: But...?
answer: I only found out later, my father was in the military. He and my mother were killed while he was on assignment, somewhere in Eastern Europe. The files were classified, but I read enough to know that he was a good man. Apparently, he was betrayed by one of his own team.

question: Wow. That's a lot for a kid to live with.
answer: Yeah, but it motivated me, losing my family. It still does. I don't take anything for granted.

question: Boy did I have you pegged wrong.
answer: How do you mean?

question: Well, to be honest, I thought you were a rich kid who inherited everything. But that's pretty typical. I've got instincts for the job, but when it comes to men? Well...
answer: I'm glad you don't see me as just a client.

question: Oh. Well, you ARE, so...
answer: Is there someone you need to be going home to?

question: No. But I... I shouldn't.
answer: Shouldn't you?

question: LET'S GO! WE'RE LOSING TIME HERE!
answer: You okay, Boss?

question: No thanks to you! You're supposed to be my head of security! Who is that bitch?!
answer: Don't know. I'll keep an eye out.

question: I'll have Systems get to work on this right away.
answer: Uh, actually Miss Wu, WE will get to work on this right away. Any evidence we find will be turned over to you AND the proper authorities.

question: I don't think you understand how important that data is, Mr...
answer: Oh, indeed I do. And that's why I'll take very good care of it when I find it.

question: Um... well...
answer: Hey Dylan, can we talk to you for a second? There's something going on between you and Knox. Isn't there?

question: So what, so I like him. Is that so wrong?
answer: Uh, yeah Dylan, it IS. He's a client.

question: She's got a point.
answer: What? She doesn't have ANY point, Alex, I can't believe you're siding with her.

question: I'm not siding with anyone, but technically, he is no longer...
answer: You know Charlie would NEVER approve of this.

question: Alex, I can't tell you how happy I am you came.
answer: Me too.

question: No, I mean, it's weird. It's weirding me out how happy I am when you're around. Am I sick or something?
answer: Got me.

question: The only bummer is, I start to jones when you're not around. What the hell am I gonna do this weekend, if you're not with me?
answer: We'll get you some sedatives. You'll be fine.

question: Hey. Wait a second. Come with me!
answer: Come with you?

question: Miami, on the Sony Jet. I've got two tickets to the Final Four.
answer: Jason, I don't...

question: Wait, before you say no, let me just say something, okay? I'm sick of how little we see each other. I'm sick of stealing a day here, or a week there.
answer: It's my job, Jason. I can't explain it, but I have to be on call, all the time, and...

question: What if I changed all that? What if I told you to quit your job, and come live with me. What I'm saying, Alex, is that I want you to...
answer: Gunfire! Get down! My God, you're hit. You're...

question: Fine. I'm fine. They're squibs, it's fake. See? Fake guns, too. They're just setting up for the next scene.
answer: Sorry about that, I...

question: God, I loved that. The way you yelled and everything? Baby, you been watching too many movies. Alright, I gotta go reset these. DON'T GO ANYWHERE. I want to finish this conversation.
answer: Nice, Alex. Real nice. Hey, is someone firing more squibs or...

question: Thanks for the second chance. I swear, I'm really not a flake.
answer: How can I deny any woman who's seen all 23 "Lords of Wind and Power"?

question: I bet there's a dozen women here who fit that description.
answer: Honestly -- there's a looks component as well.

question: Really.
answer: You're the most beautiful woman I've ever seen this close up.

question: Ladies room. I'll be back in two minutes.
answer: I'll be here.

question: Where's that music coming from?
answer: You'll see. Just a little farther.

question: Oh... Oh wow. That's amazing.
answer: Can I ask you a personal question?

question: Maybe.
answer: How much do you know about Charlie? I just find it strange that you work for a man you've never met.

question: Well, I don't know what he looks like, but I feel like I know him. We all do.
answer: And none of you have any clue who he actually is?

question: Nope.
answer: And you're never curious to find out?

question: Of course, but believe me, it's impossible. I've tried. Let's not talk about Charlie, okay? Or work. In fact, let's not talk at all. Eric, it's Vivian.
answer: Hmmm. I wonder what she's here for?

question: Want me to tell her to come back, or...
answer: No, no. I'd better deal. You go back to bed.

question: Hello?
answer: Dylan, we were set up. Vivian Wu is not who she says she is. She's a former assassin and an all around bitch.

question: Oh no. OH SHIT. Natalie, she's HERE!
answer: What?!

question: I'm at Knox's, she just showed up!
answer: I'm ten minutes away. Wait until I get there.

question: I can't do that. Call Alex and meet me here.
answer: Dylan...

question: Sorry Dylan. I knew this moment would come sooner or later. I was just hoping for later.
answer: All this time, we thought Red Star was behind this, but it was you. You faked your kidnapping. Why?

question: To gain your trust. And get your help. I want you to know, my personal attraction to you was a sincere and unrelated complication.
answer: Oh, well, in that case I feel a lot better about you being a lying pole smoker. I can't believe I trusted you.

question: Wait a minute. We installed the transmitter, yes, but we never gave him the receiver.
answer: What?

question: That laptop was the only way to access the transmitter. And we gave the laptop to...
answer: Come on, Bosley, answer. I've tried all his numbers and paged him five times. No answer.

question: Well?
answer: Our access was cut off at the source.

question: GODDAMNIT!
answer: But not before we retrieved the information you wanted. The National Security Agency's secret file on the man known as Charles Townsend.

question: Finally. How about Bosley? Did we get the information we wanted?
answer: Once we we drugged him, he sang like a bird.

question: Hmmm. Miami Arena. Preparations have been made?
answer: Yes. We move out tonight.

question: Excellent. Where IS Bosley?
answer: In the tower. We were waiting till you gave the word.

question: Well? No time like the present.
answer: It's not moving. Oh, this is the oldest one in the book. Punch up camera three. Now pan left. The old re-loop the video camera trick. And look, she's not even carrying a gun. What is this, amateur hour? Um, excuse me? I think you're trespassing. No offense, but as "storming the castle" plans go, this one sucked.

question: It's not moving. Oh, this is the oldest one in the book. Punch up camera three. Now pan left. The old re-loop the video camera trick. And look, she's not even carrying a gun. What is this, amateur hour? Um, excuse me? I think you're trespassing. No offense, but as "storming the castle" plans go, this one sucked.
answer: Oh yeah? And I suppose you could do better?

question: Yeah, I sure as hell could.
answer: Oh, right.

question: Dylan, how nice. Welcome to my Florida home. Not as tasteful as the one in LA, but much more private.
answer: So tell me, Knox, what's the brilliant plan? You gonna sell a list of our foreign spies to the highest bidder? Blackmail the President?

question: The first plan is too complicated, and the second is virtually impossible. Besides, I already have all the money I need and my motivation is much simpler... ... revenge.
answer: Revenge? Against who?

question: You know what? I'm not in a gabby mood right now. I've got a score to settle.
answer: Seems like you're going a bit overboard.

question: No, just leaving myself plenty of margin for error. Goodbye, Dylan.
answer: I don't know why you bother. I've already won.

question: Every moment I sit here is a moment I'm using to figure out how to take you down. In fact, this statement -- this one I'm making right here-- is just me stalling for time while I decide which of your goons I'm going to flatten first. It's gonna be the guy behind me.
answer: Really?

question: By the time your guys are firing, I'll be at about 180 on my reverse inverted 360, which will land me on Fat Boy there, as promised. He'll take the chair seat in the chin. Now... I'm warning both of you
answer: And what will you do to me?

question: BOSLEY! Bosley, can you hear me?
answer: Natalie! Is that you?

question: How do I get up to you?
answer: There's a staircase. Look for a switch.

question: Hello?... Pete, hi! How are you?
answer: I'm good. I just -- you said you wanted me to call.

question: I did. I do. I mean, thank you for calling.
answer: I'm not an insecure person or anything, and I've really enjoyed the very brief time we have spent together. I'm just wondering if it's something I said or did that's making this whole thing so weird between us.

question: Can you hold on a sec? One more sec. Sorry about that.
answer: Listen, is this a bad time?

question: No. Not at all.
answer: You just sound distracted.

question: You know, work this week has been really busy. It's been hard to focus. See, the thing is, I'm not a full- time waitress. I should have been more up-front about that, it's just...
answer: Natalie, what was that?

question: Yes, yes!
answer: Charlie!? Charles Townsend!

question: Alex?
answer: Jason? Shit.

question: Alex?! Jesus, what is going on?
answer: Jason, hi, I... Can I talk to you later?

question: No you can talk to me NOW. I want to know what the hell is going on. First, you disappear with no explanation, not even a goodbye.
answer: I'm sorry, I...

question: I lied to you Jason. I'm not a secretary.
answer: Yeah, I can see that.

question: And that wasn't Charlie.
answer: Right.

question: I'm actually here to stop a madman from killing everyone in this building. Would it be okay if we talked later?
answer: Go save the world, honey. I'll be waiting for you.

question: Chartreuse and magenta. This has gotta be it.
answer: I wouldn't do that, if I were you. See, if you snip ANY of those wires, the bomb WILL blow up.

question: It's gonna blow anyway, once the clock gets to zero.
answer: Who told you that, my idiotic henchman? Do you think I tell him ANYTHING that's confidential? THIS is what triggers that bomb. So if you'll kindly step away, I'll refrain from killing both of us. In different circumstances, Dylan, I think you and I could have worked out. We have a lot in common.

question: Yeah, I fall for assholes, and you ARE one.
answer: Good one. Well, I must be going. If you like your body parts attached to your torso, I suggest you do the same.

question: NO! I'll blow this building sky high, I swear!
answer: Don't do it, Eric. It's me you want, not all these innocent people.

question: Charlie?
answer: Your father was a double agent, Eric. Yes, I revealed him, but he was killed by his own people before we could throw him in jail. He was my friend.

question: It's still your fault, you arrogant prick! You still killed my father!
answer: Maybe. Maybe I did. But why should YOU kill all these people? If you hate me so much, just shoot ME. Just shoot me, Eric.
